sen.j: 大手倶楽部（おおてくらぶ）とは、明治中期の政治結社（1894年10月20日－1896年2月24日）。
sen.e: Ote club is a political association in the Middle Meiji Period (October 20, 1894-February 24, 1896).
Ote club was a political association during the mid-Meiji Period (October 20, 1894-February 24, 1896).
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Ote club was a political association during the mid-Meiji Period (October 20, 1894 - February 24, 1896).

sen.j: 第4回衆議院議員総選挙の最中に日清戦争が勃発して政治休戦が確立したのを機に、第2次伊藤内閣によって前年に解散に追い込まれた大日本協会復興を模索する動きが現れた。
sen.e: The Sino-Japanese War broke out during the 4th general election of members of the House of Representatives and political ceasefire was established, which made a move to seek a recovery of Dainihonkyokai (a political association) that was forced to dissolve by the Second Ito cabinet in the previous year appeared.

As a political truce was called due to the Sino-Japanese war that started during the 4th general elections for the House of Representatives, a move was made to restore the Dainihon Kyoukai (a political association) that had been disbanded by the Second Ito cabinet the previous year.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: As a political truce was called due to the Sino-Japanese war that started during the 4th general elections for the House of Representatives, a move was made to restore the Dainihon Kyoukai (a political association) that had been disbanded by the Second Ito cabinet the previous year.

sen.j: 元同会所属の無所属議員である大竹貫一や植田理太郎が、末吉忠晴ら対外硬に同調する無党派の無所属議員を勧誘して結成した。
sen.e: Kanichi OTAKE and Ritaro UEDA who were former members of Dainihonkyokai and independent Diet members formed it, recruiting Tadaharu SUEYOSHI and others who were non-partisan independent Diet members and sympathized with the hard-line foreign policies.
sen.cmt: 大竹貫一→http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%A4%A7%E7%AB%B9%E8%B2%AB%E4%B8%80植田理太郎→http://porta.ndl.go.jp/service/servlet/Result_Detail?meta_item_no=I000046315&meta_repository_no=R000000008末吉忠晴→http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%9C%AB%E5%90%89%E5%BF%A0%E6%99%B4参照しました。
sen.e: It was formed by Kanichi OTAKE and Ritaro UEDA, both former members of Dainihon Kyokai and independent Diet members, who then recruited Tadaharu SUEYOSHI and others who were non-partisan, independent Diet members and who sympathized with the hard-line foreign policies.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: It was formed by Kanichi OTAKE and Ritaro UEDA, both former members of Dainihon Kyokai and independent Diet members, who then recruited Tadaharu SUEYOSHI and others who were non-partisan, independent Diet members and who sympathized with the hard-line foreign policies.

sen.j: 大手倶楽部は硬六派に参加を表明し、これによって硬六派は衆議院で過半数を制した。
sen.e: Ote club announced its participation to the hard-line six parties, which made the hard-line six parties win a majority in the House of Representatives.
Ote club announced its participation to the hard-line six parties, which made the hard-line six parties win a majority in the House of Representatives.
Ote club announced its participation to the hard-line six parties, which made the hard-line six parties win a majority in the House of Representatives.

sen.j: 日清戦争中は政治休戦を支持して臨時軍事費の支出に賛同したが、戦争終結後に日英通商航海条約締結と三国干渉受諾を批判して政府と対決色を強めた。
sen.e: During the Sino-Japanese War, it backed political ceasefire and agreed with spending the extra military expenditures, but it took a more clearly adversarial stand against the government, criticizing the signing of the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation and the accepting of the Triple Intervention after the end of the war.

During the Sino-Japanese War, it backed political ceasefire and agreed with spending the extra military expenditures, but it took a more clearly adversarial stand against the government, criticizing the signing of the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation and the accepting of the Triple Intervention after the end of the war.

During the Sino-Japanese War, it backed political ceasefire and agreed with spending the extra military expenditures, but it took a more clearly adversarial stand against the government, criticizing the signing of the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation and the accepting of the Triple Intervention after the end of the war.

sen.j: 自由党 (明治)に対抗する新党結成構想が硬六派の間で進められると、これに呼応して1896年2月に解散、所属議員は同年3月1日の進歩党 (明治)結成に参加した。
sen.e: When a plan of forming a new party against the Liberal Party (Meiji) was proceeded among the hard-line six parties, it was dissolved in February 1896 in line with that, and its Diet members joined the formation of the Progressive Party (Meiji) on March 1 of the same year.

They were dissolved in February of 1896 in response to their plan to form a new party to compete wih the Liberal Party (Meiji), and it's Diet members joined the formation of the Progressive Party (Meiji) on March 1 of the same year.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: They were dissolved in February of 1896 in response to their plan to form a new party to compete wih the Liberal Party (Meiji), and it's Diet members joined the formation of the Progressive Party (Meiji) on March 1 of the same year.
